Mali si Secretary Panelo
06 Nov 2019, 09:27 by Allan Encarnacion
MARAMI pang kakaining bigas si Presidential Spokesperson Sal Panelo kung ang pag-uusapan ay ang tamang paraan ng paghahanay ng mga salita.
Sa madalas na pagkakataon, hindi man siya magaling na tagapagsalita ni Pangulong Duterte, suportado ko ang kanyang mga sinasabi. Pero sa pagkakataong ito, puwede nating sabihin na “out of bounce” siya nang sabihin niyang walang pakialam ang gobyerno sa mga seafarer nang harangin sa West Philippine Sea habang sakay ng Greek ship.
Patungo sa China ang barkong Green Aura galing Thailand nang warningan ng Tsina sa pagdaan malapit sa Scarborough Shoal. Pinoy seamen ang sakay ng barko.
Pero ayon kay Sec Panelo, hindi na concern ng Pilipinas ang sitwasyon dahil barko ng Liberian ang hinarang.
Bilang communication graduate, mayroon kaming tinatawag na “syntax.” Ito iyong tamang paggamit ng mga salita upang makabuo ka ng isang ganap at kumpletong pahayag na una, hindi lamang maiintindihan, bagkus ay katanggap-tanggap na mauunawaan.
Ang tingin ko, ang mensahe ni Panelo ay mali at maliwanag na syntax error ang salitang “hindi na concern” ng gobyerno ang insidente.
Ako naman ang mag-interpret sa maling pahayag na ito ni Panelo, baka ang gusto niyang sabihin, foreign ship naman ang hinarang kaya wala tayong pakialam...ito iyong missing words...pero dahil mga Pinoy ang sakay, titiyakin nating hindi sila sinaktan at hindi nabiktima ng anumang panghaharas.  
Ano ba namang sabihin ni Panelo na kakausapin nila ang Chinese counterpart at aalamin ang totoong nangyari dahil mga Filipino ang sakay ng barko. Dapat maitanim sa isip ng gobyerno na kahit saang parte ng mundo, kapag kababayan na natin ang nakataya, kailangang kumilos. Kahit nga akusado pa sa illegal drugs o capital offense abroad ay ipinagtatanggol ng Philippine government.
Huwag na nating isingit ang territorial dispute, doon lang tayo sa moog ng isyu na dapat, bilang estado ay nasa poder natin na ingatan, protektahan at pagsilbihan ang mga Pilipino. Ang problema ni Panelo, sa sobrang ingat na masagasaan ang pride ng China, nabubundol niya ang sensibilidad ng mga Pilipino.
Huwag nating kalilimutan na ang bawat Pinoy na nasa ibang bansa ay nagsisilbing “ambassador” ng ating bayan kaya dapat din silang pinuprotektahan.
Kaya nga obligasyon ko at ng lahat ng mga Pinoy na maging mabuting mamamayan sa kahit anong bansa na kanilang puntahan.
At dapat alam din ito ni Secretary Panelo. Hindi pa huli ang lahat, puwede pang bumawi si Atty. Sal, puwede pa siyang humingi ng dispensa at itama ang kanyang mga maling pahayag.
Be sensitive, be considerate Mr. Secretary.allanpunglo@gmail.com
text:
Secretary Panelo was wrong
06 Nov 2019, 09:27 by Allan Encarnacion
MUCH more Presidential Spokesperson Sal Panelo needs rice if talking is the right way to order words.
Frequently, although he was not a great speaker of President Duterte, I supported his remarks. But this time, we can say he was out of bounce when he said the government was unaware of the seafarers being blocked off in the West Philippine Sea while aboard a Greek ship.
The Green Aura ship from Thailand is headed to China by China for a cruise near the Scarborough Shoal. Pinoy seamen aboard the ship.
But according to Sec Panelo, the Philippines no longer cares about the situation as Liberian ships are blocked.
As a communication graduate, we have what is called a "syntax." This is your correct use of words so that you can come up with a complete and complete statement that is first, not only understandable, but understandable.
In my opinion, Panelo's message was false and the word "incident" was not a clear syntax error by the government.
I will interpret Panelo's false statement, he may say, foreign ships are blocked so we don't care ... this is your missing words ... but since Filipinos are on board, we will make sure they do not harmed and not victimized by any assault.
What Panelo says is that they will talk to the Chinese counterpart and find out what happened because the Filipino people on board. It should be borne in mind that any part of the world, once we have our country at stake, must act. Although accused of illegal drugs or capital offense abroad, the Philippine government defends it.
Let us no longer insist on territorial disputes, we are just in the fortress of the issue that should, as a state, be in our power to protect, protect and serve the Filipinos. Panelo's problem is that by over-observing China's pride, he is undermining the Filipino sensibilities.
Let's not forget that every Filipinos in the country serves as our country's "ambassador" so they should be protected too.
That is why it is my duty and all the Filipinos to be good citizens in whatever country they go to.
And Secretary Panelo should know this too. It is not too late, Atty. Sal, he can even ask for the dispensary and correct his false statements.
Be sensitive, be considerate Mr. Secretary.allanpunglo@gmail.com
